helpArticles.question: Your account number and sort code

answer.answer:
Your Monzo account is a full UK bank account, so you‚Äôve got an account number and sort code. Here's how to find them üíÅ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar
2. Tap the __Account__ button under your Monzo card (pull down on your payments list if you can't see it)
3. Find your sort code and account number under __Account Details__

The type of bank statement you need depends on what you need it for.

__For your records__

__For spreadsheets__

3. Tap __Export & bank statements__ at the bottom of the screen

__For mortgage applications__

If you need an original bank statement for a mortgage application or visa, please chat to us in the app. We can give you an original document so it won't need to be stamped or signed üìÑ

1. Tap the __Help__ icon in the menu bar
2. Search ‚Äògetting a bank statement‚Äô
3. Tap __chat to us__ under the header 'For mortgage applications'

**__Using your card in the UK is always free__**

We don‚Äôt charge any fees for paying by card or withdrawing cash in the UK. But bear in mind some cash machines will add a fee (which we don‚Äôt receive) for taking out money, so we recommend using machines that don‚Äôt charge.

Some machines will also tell you that ‚ÄòYour issuer might charge you for this‚Äô, but you can ignore that message. We don‚Äôt charge for taking out cash in the UK.

**__Paying by card abroad is always free__**

We don‚Äôt charge any fees for using your card wherever you are in the world. And if you choose to be billed in the local currency you‚Äôll get the best possible exchange rate, which is Mastercard‚Äôs standard rate with nothing added on top.

**__We might charge a small fee for withdrawing cash abroad__**

At the moment, we charge a fee for withdrawing cash abroad in some situations. 

The first ¬£200 in a rolling 30-day period is free, and after that we‚Äôll add a 3% charge to each withdrawal you make.

Your limits are shared across any account you have, so if you have a joint account your allowance is across both of them.

For example if you take out ¬£150 on the 2nd of the month and ¬£45 on the 5th, your limits would reset on the 2nd and 5th day of the __next__ month. If you did a third withdrawal before those dates, then we'd charge the withdrawal fee.

Unfortunately we can‚Äôt advise you on your tax status. But we can point you to where you‚Äôll find more [information](https://uk.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/internal-revenue-service-u-s-taxes/).

If you‚Äôre still having trouble, talk to your embassy in the UK.

Unfortunately we can‚Äôt advise you on your tax status. But we can point you to where you‚Äôll find more information. 

You should get more information from your embassy in the UK. You can also read more about taxation in the EU [here](https://europa.eu/youreurope/citizens/work/taxes/income-taxes-abroad/index_en.htm).

If you‚Äôre still having trouble, talk to your embassy in the UK.

We believe that we can give you useful, friendly, fast service without branches. 

For example, you can open an account with us in minutes on your phone, and talk to one of our lovely customer service team any time of day or night. The money we save from not operating an expensive network of branches is money we can invest in better service and new features that people really want.

There are some things that banks with branches offer which we do a little differently, with cash deposits being an example. Traditionally you would have visited a bank branch to do this, but with Monzo you can do this at any of the 28,000 PayPoint locations across the UK.

helpArticles.question: My IFTTT Monzo login button is not working

answer.answer: If after you tapped connect to Monzo you were presented with a new page that did nothing when you input your email address and tapped login to Monzo then you'll need to make sure that Javascript is enabled in your browser. This is quite a common issue on iOS, so we suggest logging in via the Chrome browser instead. If that still doesn't work, try this again on another device.

helpArticles.question: I haven't received my IFTTT login email

answer.answer:
If your login email to connect Monzo to IFTTT hasn't arrived it might be due to a number of reasons:

- Your authentication email ended up in your spam folder
- There was a typo in the email address you entered
- You used an email address that wasn't registered with us. It's common to have multiple emails, but we need you to use your Monzo registered email exactly as it appears on your account to connect you with the IFTTT service

If none of these reason seem to apply to you, get in touch with us and we'll try to help.

Monzo Labs is our way for you to help test our latest features! 

If you opt-in to Monzo Labs we'll give you access to our newest upgrades and coolest prototype features so you can give us feedback and help us build the bank you want. Go to the Account screen, then tap your name. Scroll down to 'Monzo Labs' to check out what new Labs features we have in the pipeline.

We realise that each individual has their own unique approach to managing their money, and there‚Äôs no one-size-fits-all solution! So, we've integrated with IFTTT (which is an acronym for 'If This, Then That'), a web platform that lets you personalise and automate web services and apps that you use.

You can create your own rules through IFTTT 'applets' and connect the services you use regularly. For example, if you need to keep track of your work expenses, you could create a rule using IFTTT that automatically logs the expense in a spreadsheet each time you add a receipt to a Monzo transaction.

You can create your own applets, or we have some ready-made ones available on our [IFTTT page](https://ifttt.com/monzo "IFTTT page") which you can enable these in one click.

__Signing in to IFTT__

To start using IFTTT you'll need to download their app, or go to the [website](https://ifttt.com "IFTTT"), and create an account. You can sign-in with Facebook or Google, or feel free to use any email address you like.

__Connecting with Monzo__

To start using IFTTT with your Monzo account, download the IFTTT app and sign up.

You'll receive an email from us which is identical to the email you get when you login to your Monzo app. Open this email on your phone or desktop, and tap/click the button that says 'Log In To Monzo'.

You can then start creating your own applets, or use some of our pre-made ones like the '1p Savings Challenge' or 'Send my receipts to Dropbox'.

Happy IFTTTing!
